children.subject: If the course is listed under another dept, you should contact that dept.
I'm unable to select various *88 connectors right now. The below image is for Cog Sci 88, but the same thing happened with GEOG88. Is this an issue on the CS Side or the individual department?
I'm having this same issue and have reached out to the Office of the Registrar as well as my academic adviser who forwarded the issue on. Hopefully they will have it resolved soon!
This issue HAS been resolved - please try enrolling again!

I can't enroll in 61B right now because Discussion 999 (Sunday 12:00-12:01 AM) conflicts with Lab 999A (Sunday 12:00-12:01 AM) 

What should I do? I'm CS intended so I meet the reserve seat requirements

I also see this page when looking at the class info?

"Allow Time Conflict Enrollment"
You need to contact the STAT department about getting into C8 this semester since they are handling enrollments for that class in SP19.

Since stat c8 has:

573 reserved for Freshman and Sophomore Students 
83 reserved for College of Letters & Sciences: Undeclared Junior and Senior Students
and the waitlist is currently full, as a Junior EECS, how likely am I to get into c8?
As this is EECS 101 and not Haas 101, I don't think we'll be able to answer this question. Sorry!

is it possible to have credit for the Haas stats prerequisite by taking data 8 + cs 88 after the completion of 61a, or does the rule that no credit for 88 after 61a apply to even that? Asking because the other possible connector, UGBA 96, is closed already and I wasn't sure if computer science declaration rules apply to cs88 as well. Thank you!
I JUST updated the note - class has expanded to 1500.

For 61B, is there any info on when you will receive approval to exceed room capacity? I'll actually have to phase 2 CS61B and was wondering approximately when class enrollment will be allowed to expand.

You have NOT been enrolled from the wait list into the following class:

Term: 2019 Spring

Class: COMPSCI   152 

Section: 001

Reason: Time conflict with another section.

As neither class allows time conflict enrollments, you will remain on the waitlist unless or until you resolve the time conflict.

Actions you can take:

  • Drop the class that has a time conflict with the one above.

  • Select a different section of either class to resolve the time conflict.

  • If you want only the above class: Request a swap with the time-conflicted class.  This requires relinquishing your position on the waitlist

I got this email but I'm confused why it won't take me off the waitlist because of a time conflict even though it's a CS class. If I drop the conflict class will it definitely enroll me or not?

For EE 16B, there are 36 open seats, all for "students with enrollment permission." I was wondering what this exactly means, because quite evidently there are labs still open for EE16B in the class.berkeley.edu academic guide, and in order to fill the class, in the future there would be no restraint on the particular seats, correct?

 

I've had some change of plans in regards to courses for the upcoming semester and it's likely that I'll be taking 16B in the spring

history.content:
(updated 11/20/18)

This is the master list of announcements for SP19 lower div CS classes.  General enrollment information is at the end of this post.

 

  • CS C8 – Enrollment for Data 8 is being managed by the STAT department in SP19. Please enroll in STAT C8 and contact that department with enrollment questions if you are interested in the class.

  • CS 10 – This class will NOT use 999 sections in SP19. This means you need to enroll in the lecture as well as specific discussion and lab sections.

    If you are waitlisted and wish to change sections of the class, you will need to DROP the class and re-enroll. If you are accidentally dropped to the end of the waitlist when this happens, we will NOT be able to restore you to your previous wait list position.

  • (update 10/24/18) CS 61A – Enrollment expanded to 1275 and will be webcast. Enroll into the lecture and 999 and 999A sections.

  • (update 11/20/18) CS 61B - Class expanded to 1500 and will be webcast. Enroll into the lecture and 999 and 999A sections.

  • (update 10/24/18) CS 61C – Enrollment expanded to 750 and will be webcast. Enroll into the lecture and 999 and 999A sections.

  • CS 70 – Enroll into the lecture and the 999 section.

  • (update 11/20/18) CS 88 – Class expanded by adding another lecture (enrollment) section. It will be simulcast. If one lecture is full, try enrolling into the other.This class will NOT use 999 sections in SP19. 

    If you are waitlisted and wish to change sections of the class, you will need to DROP the class and re-enroll. If you are accidentally dropped to the end of the waitlist when this happens, we will NOT be able to restore you to your previous wait list position.

 

 

The remainder of this post contains general enrollment information.

 

  1. To see who can enroll into CS lower div classes and when, read: https://eecs.berkeley.edu/resources/undergrads/cs/degree-reqs/enrollment-policy#lower


  2. Time Conflicts - The enrollment system WILL ALLOW time conflicts between CompSci classes and other classes. However, even though CalCentral will allow enrollment into both classes, it is still the student’s responsibility to plan their schedule carefully. Departments and faculty are NOT required or expected to accommodate students’ schedule conflicts, and the Instructor of Record may decline to enroll or Instructor Drop a student from a class if they cannot be present for all schedule activities, including midterms and finals.

    Best practice is to check attendance policies for each class and to speak to the instructors before enrolling in time conflicted classes.

  3. Waitlist Processing:

  • We will NOT purge the waitlist of non-CS/EECS majors at the end of phase 1 this semester.

  • During the Adjustment Period, wait lists are automatically processed in numerical order based on the waitlist position. A student’s major is NOT taken into consideration when the wait list is processed. During Phases 1 and 2, students who meet reserve requirements for a class will be enrolled from the wait list if there are open seats, even before students with a better wait list position who do not meet reserve requirements.

  • If enrolling the student into the class will put them over the maximum number of units, the system will also skip the student when processing the wait list. Units for wait listed classes count towards the upper unit limit: 13.5 phase 1, 17.5 phase 2, and 20 units over all.

  • Waitlisted students who have time conflicts will no longer be held on the waitlist and will now be processed in sequential order like any other student. (As in the past, not meeting a reserve cap or exceeding the unit limit will still prevent students from being enrolled from the wait list.)

    Students on the waitlist for a class are NOT guaranteed to get into the class and should make a reasonable back-up plan.

 

  1. 999 sections will be used for lower division classes for EXCEPT CS 10. These are faux sections that allow students to enroll in the lecture and the 999 section(s) only via Cal Central. 

    Since students no longer drop/re-enroll when they want to switch sections, they will no longer risk being bumped to the end of the waitlist when they need to make a change. Additionally, the 999 section has no scheduled day or time which reduces the number of time conflicts that must be processed online. It DOES mean that students need to be patient and wait until class starts to know which section they will actually attend.

    Students can still see the actual section days/times via classes.berkeley.edu



          Assignments to actual sections will be handled outside of Cal Central by faculty either:

  • During first lecture

  • Via communication from instructor to use alternate form (e.g. Google form or SignMeUp!)

  • Via course home page
